scenes.location: SECURITY STATION. SMITH'S GROVE STATE HOSPITAL. DAY.
characters: TRIANGLE HOLE WHERE HIS NOSE ONCE WAS AND A JAGGED SMILE
EXT. GATE ENTRANCE. LAURIE'S PROPERTY. DAY
INT. CELL. SMITH'S GROVE STATE HOSPITAL. NIGHT
EXT. BACKYARD. BABY-SITTER'S HOUSE. MOMENTS LATER.
INT. NELSON HOUSE. LIVING ROOM. MOMENTS LATER.
EXT. LOADING AREA. SMITH'S GROVE STATE HOSPITAL. NIGHT
CARVED LIKE A JACK O' LANTERN WITH TRIANGLE EYES CUT OUT,
THE LIGHT TURNS OFF. TOTAL BLACKNESS.
EXT. SMITH'S GROVE STATE HOSPITAL. DAY
INT. FARM HOUSE. LIVING ROOM. DAY
WITH A BLADE. A FLASH LIGHT POINTS UP THROUGH THE NECK
INT. KITCHEN. BABY-SITTER'S HOUSE. MOMENTS LATER.
INT. REST ROOM. SERVICE STATION. DAY
THE GUN GOES OFF AND DROPS.
THE SHAPE IS WEARING THE MASK LOOKING AT HER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold brick building. Isolated. Surrounded on all sides barbed-wire fencing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RENTAL CAR pulls up to the SECURITY GATE. A SECURITY GU checks the credentials of the driver. The Guard nods to t GUARD BOOTH. The GATE OPENS. The rental car drives throug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A HAND holding a MICROPHONE. The hand cranes th mike around the to pick up sounds of maniacal laughter echoing from the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERTS of the corresponding inspiration of these sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: DANA HAINES (30's), activating a TAPE RECORDER. S with AARON JOSEPH-KOREY (40); both scholarly, British. Aa signs some documents at a CHECK-IN DESK. They look to eac other. Aaron speaks into her microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check, check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testing, testing. One, two, three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the SECURITY GUARDS, a NURSE works behind the secur desk of what looks to be a minimum security institution. nurse places a needle on a record player. A joyous song f a 1930's musical plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron looks through the security window and sees a DOCTOR writing something down and speaking to a PATIENT and a gu KUNEMAN. His ballpoint pen runs out of ink. He shakes it, discards it and then reaches into his lab coat pocket for more elegant pen to complete his prescription and signatu He glances through the glass at his visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana raises her mic to the door. WE HEAR SOUNDS through warped distortion. THEN: A loud BUZZER snaps us back to reality as a ward activates the door lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The mechanics of the security locks, bars, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GREEN LIGHT FLASHES as the door opens and DR. RANBIR SARTAIN appears. A psychiatrist with a thick accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. I'm Dr. Ranbir Sartain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for taking the time to meet with us. We were hoping to have this chance before he is transferred to the new facility. Glass Hill is far less                                accommodating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass Hill is the pit of hell.                        Underfunded and short staffed. For years he has been kept here to be studied. I suppose the state has lost interest in discovering anything further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... That's why we're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I record this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud BUZZER as the door shuts. Sartain escorts Aaron an Dana down a hall. Disturbed faces of PATIENTS pass. Many behind bars, others with CLINICAL ESCORTS. Dana records Sartain as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been working with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've examined every case file written on him. I was a scholar of Dr. Loomis before he passed away. Then I lobbied the University of Illinois to be assign to Michael                      myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any progress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has been seen by over 50 clinical psychiatrists. And with each, many different opinions. Loomis reasoned that he was nothing more than pure evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any you agree with this diagnosis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evil is not a diagnosis. Under my care, we implemented a holistic form of therapy. Since that time, his tendency for violence has essentially been erased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His response to your specific treatment has been effective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We left two kitty cats in his cell overnight and both remained unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to disappoint you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron stop walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're telling us that there is no similarity between the murderous maniac that made newspaper headlines in 1978 and the amenable patient of this institution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartain laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Myers is an evolving, aging creature like we all are. And although we have worked very closely with him, these halls display the limitations of my analysis. Loomis saw Michael as a            beast in the wild. He witnessed human behavior at its most primal, while the rest of us only have the opportunity of observation in captivity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartain uses a key to open a heavy door that leads into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartain walks them into an outside courtyard. A few DISFIGURED or DISABLED RESIDENTS roam about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our patients get fresh air and sunshine, a view, proper exercise, a healthy diet. It pains me to see                     him transferred to a less than                         desirable' facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is. He can speak. He just chooses not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Dana look. WE FIND THE SHAPE OF A MAN sixty fee away standing shackled to the ground in the middle of the concrete yard. A YELLOW PAINTED SQUARE creates a twenty f frame around him. Tall, strong, aged, dressed in white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SECURITY OFFICERS stand watch. SIX OTHER PATIENTS sta scattered through the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to stand near him and get a sense of his awareness... Or lack of awareness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make no mistake. He is aware. He was watching you as you arrived. When he's not out here in the courtyard, he walks from this window to that window, to the other. Observing things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Dana look curiously to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And perhaps you'd like to tie your left shoelace. Mr Tovoli, the gentleman with the umbrella, has a fixation for such things. Underestimate no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A patient holding AN UMBRELLA in the sunshine bites a fingernail and smiles at them. Embarrassed, Aaron bends d to tie his clean white sneaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step up to the yellow line. No further. Do not pass the line under any circumstance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartain looks to the security guards for reassurance and walks Aaron and Dana to the yellow line on the concrete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape stands with his back to them. Sartain calls out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael. I have some people who would like to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael. My name be Aaron. I've followed your case for years, and I still know very little about you. I want to know more about that night.                    About those involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape is motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think of them? Feel guilt about their fate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron looks back to Dana with a shrug.   She hesitantly s forward to join her partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember Laurie Strode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape stretches his fingers and then rests his hand a his side. Sartain notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she remind you of your sister, Michael? Is that why you chose her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape half turns, as if he's going to respond... but doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron looks back to Sartain. He nods to Aaron to go ahead Aaron looks to Dana. She unzips her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I borrowed something from a friend at the Attorney General's office. Something I'd like you to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron's hand goes inside Dana's shoulder bag and pulls ou portion of a WHITE HALLOWEEN MASK. Familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartain looks to see this exchange. Aaron holds the mask before him. The Shape makes no movement. The other patien become restless. Pacing madly. Dana looks around, concern Aaron doesn't lower the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You recognize this, don't you, Michael? How does it make you feel? Say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of the patients start screaming. Testing their restraints like rabid animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana looks to Sartain. He is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More patients join in, stomping and screaming, getting lo and louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron shouts back to The Shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say SOMETHING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtyard has been worked into a frenzied chorus of madness, but The Shape remains still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA inside a closet with thin wooden slats. A beautifu girl, ALLYSON NELSON (17), appears as the door opens. Her face has a soft innocent quality. Eyes are bright and ali

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the closet light switch string. The LIGHT BULB flickers but doesn't turn on. She pulls the switch again; nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rummage through the shirts and picks out a workout jacket, closing the closet door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson makes her bed. The decor of her room is that of a young woman with artifacts of childhood lingering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson goes for a jog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson jogs past a chain link fence in front of a house. DOG BARKS ferociously. A little startled, she takes a dee breath and continues down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson jogs by a residential community garden. Flowers, vegetables, etc. Much of it dead. A BANGLADESHI WOMAN wra plant to protect it from the weather of the off season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY NELSON, 45, opens up a kitchen cabinet and sets a mou trap with peanut butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see this? I switched from marshmallow fluff to peanut butter. We'll see if the little devil snatches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANAH NELSON, 38, makes breakfast. She lives life. The beauty and heart behind her eyes is hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson enters trying to fix a broken zipper on her schoo bag. The traffic plays on a radio with lighthearted DISC JOCKEYS. Competing with that, a television is on with an INFOMERCIAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rescheduled my last session, so I'll be able to make it tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to do that. It's not that big of a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is. You got into National Honor Society. It's a very big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was top of my shop class, made ashtrays and birdhouses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray loads up another mouse trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm looking forward to meeting Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know his father Lonnie and his uncle James. The entire Elam family                    has a... reputation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoots a look) Ray, c'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! You know about his situation, right? It's a relevant factor. The whole household is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mouse trap snaps in Ray's hand, smashing his finger. jumps, startled. His finger bleeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair, dad. Cameron isn't                    like that. He's a nice guy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray walks to the sink to wash his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying he's not nice. It's just- You're too smart to go out with troublemakers and dip shits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you guys invite Grandmother like you said you would?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah looks to Ray. They make eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. Talked to her yesterday. She's not going to be able to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson zips up her back-pack and give her mom a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray kisses his hurt finger and gives Shanah a nervous loo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's agoraphobic. In serious need of cognitive... Um... behavioral-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A buzzer RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky's here. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray turns off the sink and stare awkwardly at his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a JACK-O-LANTERN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE (17) takes a hit off a joint and blows smoke through top. It billows through the eyes. Dave get a coughing fit hustles to keep up with his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKY (17) walks in front of him. She's an outspoken intellectual. Doesn't take any shit. Allyson walk with th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom is a liar. She told me she invited my Grandmother tonight but she didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never even called her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your mom's deal? Why would she say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just tries to keep me away from her. Says she turns into a nutcase            this time of year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your grandmother is Laurie Strode. If I were her I wouldn't celebrate            either. I'd put up a Christmas tree instead. Just skip over all the               spooky Halloween shit, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumping to Thanksgiving would make sense. Puritans, cornucopias, plagues, starvations, slaughtering the Indians. That stuff isn't creepy at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she ever talk around it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much all she talks about. It defines her life. She's been in shock ever since. You should see her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't it her brother that killed those baby-sitters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think people made up the bit about them being related because it made them feel better. Like it couldn't happen to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To have a bunch of your friends get           slaughtered by some random crazy person... how awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it though? I just feel like the            universe has way worse shit now. One dude just kills a few people, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her grandmother is a bad ass and was almost fucking murdered, Dave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she escaped! And he was caught! He's like super incarcerated right now. It's not like the worst thing that has happened to a person. By today's standards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vikcy stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Dave. Stop talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I sensed myself going on a rant and didn't know how to eject. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees another jack-o-lantern in front of a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool if I explode this pumpkinhead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson takes the top off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave lights A firecracker, stuffs it into the jack-o-lant and plants it on the sidewalk. It starts to sizzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooooo! happy Halloween!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It EXPLODES as they run away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GROUPED SHOTS strike WITH PRECISION in THE HEART OF A TAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding a smoking gun, years of anxiety cut through a beautiful face. The dark circles under the eyes show a li filled with lidless nights. This is LAURIE STRODE (57), f better or worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's surrounded by wilderness except for the sack with barrels and targets and department store mannequins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets the gun down, pulls a bottle of pills out of her pocket and taps one into her mug of coffee. She drinks, w her mouth, picks up a different gun. A high power semi- automatic weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fires at the staged mannequins. Their heads and bodie erupt into shrapnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie drives an ATV. It rolls to the farm house with a f tire. She comes to a stop to examine the issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We notice that the downstairs windows have bars covering the glass for security. Wind chimes give a tranquil feel the fortified compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS: Laurie disassembles and cleans her firearms like a pro. She wears a tank top that reveals a across her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rental car drives down a road through an isolated fores and pulls up to a gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron speaks into a recorder as he drives. Dana holds a m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it we're after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see the animal inside its environment. I fear there has been no rehabilitation. In this case it seems one monster created another. A victim locks herself away. Imprisoned by her own fear. Our goal is to get them in a room together. Can we find a form of rehabilitation if she faces him again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Dana stop the car and look to an intercom next an overflowing mail box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out an envelope of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Journalists don't pay for interviews, Dana. This is her fifteen minutes of fame. There are two people in this world that care about her and they're both in this car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noting her file) She's financially unstable. Had every job you can think of for the last forty years from catering to cosmetology. Currently unemployed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirty dishes are overflowing in the kitchen. The rest of home isn't much better. Books and supplies stacked every where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie cleans a Smith and Wesson revolver. She opens the cylinder and see a SINGLE fastball inside. She takes out bullet and considers it. She puts it back and spins the cylinder. Engaged. She cocks the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUZZ startles her. Laurie eyeballs four black and white security camera monitors. She looks to the arrival of her uninvited guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SPEAKER hisses to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron struggles to reach the "press to speak" button. It' too far so he opens his door just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We're looking for Laurie Strode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Aaron Joseph Korey and- Um... We're working on a um... on a podcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're investigative journalists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have a moment. We've travelled a long way to speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll pay you for your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing. Dana hands Aaron AN ORANGE ENVELOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does three thousand dollars sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a pause, the gate buzzes open. Dana gives Aaron a l as they drive through the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie, Aaron and Dana are seated. Dana presses record on recording device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've lived here since 1985.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds about right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel isolated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell yourself that you're protecting your family. That if he come for you again you've distanced yourself from everyone that you love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie doesn't respond. An awkward moment. Dana nods at A and steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and I have made several award winning public radio exposes. Our last project shed fresh light on a murder case from twenty years ago. We like to re-examine incidents with an unbiased lens. When people are willing to face a thing in a different light over time, new truths can sometimes emerge. I believe there is a lot to learn from the horror you experienced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to re-examine. Nothing to learn from something that happened forty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is he real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boogeyman. I've read you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe in The Boogeyman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe in Michael Myers, a deranged serial killer. But The Boogeyman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have archival recordings of Dr. Loomis from after that horrific night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His intellect was overcome with abstract and apocalyptic observations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just wanted Michael dead and no one would listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Myers is a human being that killed his sister when he was six years old. And then he came after                    you... We want to know why. We want a glimpse inside his mind. That's why your story be important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two failed marriages. A rocky family relationship with your daughter and grandaughter. Among other issues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron nods to a few empty pill bottles strewn about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's interesting that Michael killed five people and he's a human being. I'm twice divorced and I'm a                  basket case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apologies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie gets up and scavenges aimlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nothing but vague, very blemished memories of that night. The insight you're here for does not exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're transferring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be locked away till the end of his days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you surrender any efforts of rehabilitation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Because everyone knows 40 years is when you typically turn the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana switches gears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk about when the state came to take your daughter away. She was twelve years old. They said you were unfit mother. How long until you regained custody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. But I bet you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie looks out the front door window to the outside. Getting lost in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Strode. We want you to sit down with him. Sit with Michael in a safe environment. He won't talk to anybody... But he might speak to you. Finally you can get the chance to say what you've always wanted to say to him. Come with us. Let us                       help you free yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's up. I'll accept my payment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron pull the orange envelope out. He take it to her. Sh counts it, then opens the front door and looks to the tre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your journalistic insights, I'm sure you'll be able to find your way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We dawdle on Laurie in a moment of contemplation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BELL RINGS. Allyson closes her locker with a handful books and turns to be startled by a figure standing behin her. We reveal CAMERON ELAM (17).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gottcha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson drops her books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron helps her pick up her books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you, babe. Do you have                          everything for your costume tomorrow night? Bonnie and Clyde must roll as one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just thinking about tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight? Come on. I thought you were joking when you said your parents were old fashioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be nice. It'll be nice. I just want you to meet them. I'm more old fashioned than they are. Just don't make them like you too much. I like to keep them on edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grin and gives him a kiss.    CLOSE ON THE KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, Smoochy. Give me a                         slice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron and Allyson pull apart to reveal OSCAR (17) a fas talking slime ball with charm. He gives them each a kiss the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you got your chapped lip crusties all over me, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have everything for your                            costume tomorrow night? Tango and Cash must roll as one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar puts on Chap Stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You said we were going as Sly and Kurt, bro. You said we were                         doing this Halloween dance thing. What's up? You're ditching me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar gets Cameron in a headlock and drives him into the wall. Allyson rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you lovebirds later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I well see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off shaking her head with a smile. A girl, KIM, gives her a funny look from across the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Shanah. She leads a discussion for A GROUP OF AT RISK CHILDREN (ages 7-10) that sit with their heads on a table in a counseling session. Each have HOME MADE puppet that speak their emotions. One kid tries to untangle a YO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Bradley and I get angry at the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When my brother comes home from school I get scared cuz he brings the guys to fight and throw people through walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Child #3 puts her marionette down and raises her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you run away from home then you have no one to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to look at those who love us for protection and comfort but listen to our feelings. We all have lived through difficult situations and are confronted with bad people from time to time, but by using our voice we can overcome                      our problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a facility in a run-down neighborhood. MIDDLE AGE COMMUNITY MEMBERS play basketball as kids from Shanah's therapy load onto a VAN ushered away by her assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie pulls up in her small pick-up truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah stands in her office watching a CHATTERING TOOTH T on her desk as she packs up her files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah. I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah takes a final sip off coffee and glances up. Not expecting to see Laurie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hello mother.   New glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson reached out to me-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I specifically told you you're not to have any communication with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't control who calls me. She's her own person and she's making her own decisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she reach out to you about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joining you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting. I guess she hasn't picked up on the fact that you... raised me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I raised you the way I did for your own protection and you're telling me I ruined your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a mental health care professional, I would hope you could empathize in some way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah leaves her office with an empty coffee mug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah puts her mug in the dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie appears, holding the yo-yo the kid was trying to untangle. She untangles it to deflect herself from the issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Myers is leaving Smith Grove. I've spent years petitioning for his transfer. He'll spend the rest of his life at a prison in Colorado. I'm going to do what I can to put my past behind me. It's been forty years. I just wanted to come here today and tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a moment in attempt to connect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy that you're ready to put your past behind you, but I've got to figure out if I can put our past behind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie turns to leave. Shanah switch gears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson is being rewarded at school                     tonight and then we're going to have a family dinner after. It's important to her. She wants you to come. So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two strong woman stand in hopeful silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Dana sit in their motel room going over Dr. Loo files. They have research articles, essays, forensic exhibits, photos of Laurie and her family, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron hits play on a TAPE RECORDER. The recording is old wobbly-- muffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Dr. Samuel Loomis, January 1979. Do you wish to give a statement regarding your former patient Michael Myers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My suggestion is termination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens and a slit of light reveals THE SHAPE standi with his back to us, facing the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuneman enters. He's with a young guard, HASKELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-2201. Myers, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot of sodium thiopental would                       render him unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape's feet shuffle down the hall. The other patient line facing the wall CHATTER in their clinical attire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand up! Hands up! Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a shot of potassium chloride to stop his heart. He would go quietly, without incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands on the wall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuneman reads more names from a check-list:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-2209 Aaron White... A-2217 Anthony Murphy. A-2243-Jeffrey Neundorf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOUD BUZZER sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuneman and Haskell walk the line of 12 patients outside, including a wild-eyed man, LYNCH, walking behind The Shap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be with him to make sure his life is ended. My ear on his chest to hear for myself that his vitals no longer function. At that point with the help of a coroner we will extract the brain for our studies and then incinerate the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line of patients walk to a SECURE TRANSPORT BUS where ARMED DRIVER checks his own list. The patients load on th bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Sartain walks up just as The Shape steps up in lin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Michael. I'll be by your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A REARVIEW MIRROR as Sartain enters by the Armed Driver sitting at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartain takes notes with his elegant pen and looks down t aisle at the TWELVE PATIENTS in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape sits in a middle seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It needs to die. It wants to die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartain sits in the seat behind the driver and observes Haskell and Kuneman securing shackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-7367 secure. All clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuneman walks to Sartain up front. He shuts the metal barricade that separates the patients from the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still not sure why you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Myers is my patient until he is in somebody else's care. I'm seeing my duty through till the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Haskell secures Lynch, Lynch starts SCREAMING. Haskell hits him in the gut, and settles him back in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buckle up, Dr. Sartain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to be won from keeping evil alive and gestating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuneman signals the driver. Sartain flick his pen and wat The Shape gaze out the window as the bus departs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bus drives out the front gate, we REVEAL: Laurie sitting in her car outside the facility. She watches The Shape be driven out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destruction is the only solution for Michael. A quiet death before it kills again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bus disappears, Laurie has a moment to herself. Sh pulls a bottle of pills out from her purse and takes one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the Boogeyman to bed now, will you Kiddo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds her head and watches the security gate close, struggling with the complexity of the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah, Allyson, Ray, and Cameron sit in a booth at an Italian joint. Allyson's honor award sits on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said she was going to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she would. She came to my office. We had a nice talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really have a talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being honest with you. We all have to be truthful from now on no matter how much it might hurt us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson's grandmother has had some struggles, Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a lot of addiction in family too. A lot of troubled individuals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we have a nice dinner now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray nods and looks at Cameron who sympathizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, do you know I went to school with your father? He used to sell me Peyote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. I learned a lot about myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He, um... He's weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Ray, that's like a massive over-share for our new friend. (changing the subject) Do you have any special All Hallow's Eve plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson looks to Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you and Cameron have a little fun tomorrow night. I hear there's a thing at school. What is                      it, a dance or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah and Ray smile knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moms talk too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is happy for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you guys are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie walks up.   She's a little buzzed, twitchy, sniffl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I didn't think you were coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie looks to Allyson and winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrapped up later than expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie looks to Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you must be the new heart throb. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie holds out her hand. Cameron shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron Elam. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a firm handshake. Not wet and clammy like Ray's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful to see you, Laurie. We're casually getting to know Cameron here and we're having a nice little celebration in honor of Ally-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've all got something to celebrate tonight, don't we? How was the ceremony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was very nice. Want to have a seat, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie notices Allyson's honor award and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie grabs a chair and pulls it up next to their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm used to it. I'm a bad mom when I don't show up and a bad mom when I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. Reset. Let's start over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I agree. Where's the waiter so I can get a drink? I mean if I look the part... Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Waiter? Drinks? Does ANYBODY work here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. We were just about to get the check actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we weren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure Cameron could use a stiff one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. He looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray been throwing you the 3rd degree about your family? Have you slept with my granddaughter yet, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I'm just kidding. Anyway, where is this waiter??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie stands to get service just as the waiter is walkin past with a TRAY OF FOOD. Laurie's head lifts right into tray sending glasses and plates SHATTERING LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the restaurant looks. Allyson's eyes fill wit tears of embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie continues walking out the door. Allyson turns her to see her grandmother walks toward the busy street and s just before getting hit by cars. Horns blare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson runs out. She carefully crosses to join her grandmother and they share an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRE-LAP: The sound of RADIO static blasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FATHER (40's) drives with his college FOOTBALL RANTING (14) in the passenger seat. Father fiddles with the radio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't reception on this thing ever since the antenna was bent at the car wash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine if they had won last week. They got hit with the 18th-ranked offense, but they totally got wrong ball protection. They had season-                      worst marks of negative-eight                          rushing yards, 295 total yards and five turnovers. Randall scored twenty-eight points off those takeaways, including 21 in the decisive second half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father turns off the radio in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! Can't we just listen to the silence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Father HARD breaks the truck, skidding to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: a MAN WITH A HAUNTED FACE IN A PATIENT'S gown standing in the middle of the road looking at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened to you, Hoss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, dad. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Father turns to his left and sees SEVERAL WANDERING PATIENTS on the side of the road. The TRANSPORT bus is ju off the road near a thicket of trees. EMERGENCY LIGHTS BLINKING in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here Lumpy. I'll check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Father grabs a mag LIGHT from the glove-box and a rif from his gun rack and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You okay? You fellas all right? Want some help out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Son calls 911. The HAUNTED PATIENT wanders away. Anot one slap the glass of his window and smiles. The Son shak his head `no'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? Hello? Yes. There's been an accident or something... There's a bus. People running around in the road... Lemme check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Son looks out the window where he sees a mile marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Looks like mile 227. - Yes. That back road just past Old Willard_Bridge. -- My dad went to                       look. I don't know-- Hold on. I'll go check...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Son opens his door. He gets out. All is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients are gone. No sign of his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches back in the truck and grabs the second rifle. walks across the tall grass of the empty field toward the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly an ARM reaches OUT OF THE GRASS and grabs the bo the ankle. The boy gasps. He looks down to see a near lifeless Kuneman with his arm outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy looks at the bloody victim lying in the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are on their way. What happened? Where's my dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuneman gnarls something and spits blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuneman spits more blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait there. I'll get my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuneman passes out. The boy looks around, aiming his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? Daddy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes aim and steps toward the open door of the bus an sees the dead driver. He steps onto the bus and looks to back. Suddenly, Sartain rises from under a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Without hesitation, the kid shoots Sartain in the shoulder. Sartain falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw ffff-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid panics and sprints back to the truck. He climbs i the driver's seat, turns the key in the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind him, The Shape appear inside the truck, grabs by the throat and attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah consoles an upset Allyson as Cameron and Ray walk from Laurie's truck. She drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to know this. I was raised to trust no one. Our house was a bunker and I lived on lockdown my entire childhood. We'd hide in the basement every time the paranoia set in. I still have nightmares about that room. She didn't let me go to school. Instead she trained me to shoot and fight until social services came and took me away. I chose to forget the neurosis she planted in my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray approaches and hands Allyson the orange envelope that Aaron gave Laurie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me to give you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson turns away and looks inside the envelope and sees cash, then looks to Cameron who stands near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like she's spent her entire adult life preparing for the past. She lives every day in fear he's coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray gives his wife a supportive kiss on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A PINBALL MACHINE as the flipper and lights anim the bells and buzzers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL OFFICER FRANK HAWKINS (63), a uniformed police off in full command of his evening's amusement. This is an aggressive game at a corner convenience store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COREY and STANFORD stand beside coaching his moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAMEEL, an employee, fills up drinks at the slushy fount nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Hawkins, you want that strawberry slushy or blue raspberry slushy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in wizard mode, Shameel. Get me a coffee if you don't mind. Thanks. I'll get you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins gets frustrated and slaps the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another loss for hot fuzz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the ball comes down loose, don't hit that bounce pass. It's gonna hit off that broken flipper then whack the bottom of the slingshot and go down the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new ball emerges as Hawkins' radio squawks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch to unit 601. We have a 1050 on Marla Road. Please respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy dispatch. I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shameel hands Hawkins a coffee as he hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks man. Hey Corey, take over my game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot fuzz personified, born to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Hawkins pulls up to the site of the transport bus Hawkins gets out of his squad car. He has a strong, confi build, but warily approaches. The patients are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff's Department! If you need assistance, please let yourself be known!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins looks and sees Kuneman dead on the side of the ro He speaks into his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signal 13. I have an officer down. Officer down. I need assistance. Send back-up right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches back into his car and pulls out a scatter gun a Surefire Weapon-light. He approaches the scene. Sees something near the back end of the bus that catches his e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a figure sitting in the glare of the blinking re light, looking upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins shines his light onto the figure. It doesn't move

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins sees that it's THE FATHER, dead, sitting with his head tilted too far back, mouth agape. He shines the beam the Father's neck and sees the BUMPY bone pushing up on t neck underneath, snapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins turns to see the Son, dead in a pool of blood . H kneels next to the boy to check for a pulse. None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears a voice FROM INSIDE THE BUS. The back door is op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins climbs up and sees: DR. SARTAIN, shell shocked in aisle bleeding from the gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show your hands!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his gun light, Hawkins sees that Sartain is chained seat. He climbs onto the bus. Sartain heaves for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. Help is coming. Stay with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartain looks up at the Officer, his eyes wild and open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he... Did he escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Did who escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartain softly closes his eyes as we HEAR SIRENS in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana takes a shower. Through the steam of the hot water, rinses her hair and closes her eyes. We watch the water r down the drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the bathroom door open slowly and a figure enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing still behind the shower curtain is the body of a in THE MASK. He stands a beat and then pull the curtain b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room for one more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that hideous thing off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron takes off the mask and puts it on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I wear this, there is a certain tendency or inclination that the legacy of the mask seems to inspire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't murder me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never. I need your smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron step into the shower and gives Dana a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV SET in the other room casts a glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson jogs down the sidewalk through her neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson runs by the community garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HANDHELD CAMERA implies an OBSERVER from behind some standing plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Allyson jogs on, she notices A FEW PEOPLE congregating a LARGE TREE. They're looking at something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who in the hell would do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson joins everyone looking UP at something horrible - DEAD DOG hung by his neck from a tree branch. The same he that barked at her the day before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson is visibly upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neighbor reaches up to touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson notices a vehicle down the street. It's the famil BRONCO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, the onlookers struggle to get the dog down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie awakens in her truck. Tired after a tough night. S looks at herself in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie makes coffee. The local news playing on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police have not determined the cause of the accident, but we do know there are multiple fatalities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie turns to look at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to sources, authorities have sent personnel from a local state hospital. At this time, we do not know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: POLICE SCANNER turning on, bolt lock spinning t and bottoms of doors. A knife sheath is clicked onto Laur belt. The canvas curtains are ZIPPED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie walks over to an island in the kitchen. She turns island counter-clockwise to reveal A DOOR in THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door and looks into the darkness of a storm shelter below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs down a ladder and slips into the shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIGHT flicks on. The door shuts behind her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creeping through the tall brown grass, we find Aaron and walking through expansive rows of crooked tombstones. The walk with the CARETAKER, who lead them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin works at a graveyard not too far from here. They got War Generals, Philanthropists, a beatnik poet. They got Muddy Waters                     and Bernie Mac. People come from all over to pay respects. But this gal from Haddonfield. This is our                       only claim to fame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to a grave and stop. Dana kneel down in front o the grave and looks at the name: JUDITH MYERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can explain to me what's so spectacular about Judith Myers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana is in a zone. Transfixed with the history of this place, she speaks into her recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...As she sat combing her hair. Unaware. Her six year old brother crept in quietly with a kitchen knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of disgust on the caretaker's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron joins in. She hands him the recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He then proceeded to slice the base of her skull down to her spinal                        chord, here... (demonstrates on self) ...then she turned and raised her hands in self-defense. He continued stabbing into the arteries and nerves of her palms, like so... (points to palms) Once she collapsed, three more stabs in her sternum, piercing her                     heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caretaker looks put off by the vivid story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about sternums.   All I know is we've had to replace   this stone two times, people come   around and put demon pentagrams and   voodoo shit on it. Every Halloween.   Crazy coconuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana pull out a camera and snaps some picture of the grav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: The Shape watches from across the cemetery, unbeknownst to Aaron and Dana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron pumps gas at a service station. Dana has her resear spread out on the back seat of the car. She ponders headl from NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS in her binder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron looks up and sees A CHURCH VAN at the pump opposite him. In the back seat is AN ELDERLY WOMAN staring at him her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL POV: the Old Woman is actually looking BEHIND AARO where she see THE SHAPE step out of the Bronco. A man in white patient attire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron doesn't see as The Shape walks into the opened gara where the Mechanic works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could get those initial police transcripts from the press                       conference and post-conviction proceedings we might have a great prologue for our story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana gets out of the car and goes to Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have access to Brackett's personal journal on Michael as well as city records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana heads inside. She walks past an open garage where a MECHANIC in a JUMPSUIT works to put a tire on to a wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron sees the Old Woman still staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Woman's DAUGHTER AND GRANDSON get in the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron watches them drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back out around the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the bathroom at the side of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana takes a paper towel from the dispenser   and walks t the stalls. She uses the tissue to push the   first door She grimaces and heads to the second stall.   Not much be She continues to the third stall and pushes   the door op It's acceptable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters the stall, places the paper towel on the bowl, pulls down her pants and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dana sits on the toilet, she sees graffiti scrawled on stalls: "Amazing grace come sit on my face. Don't make me cry, I need your... pie"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out a pencil, scratches out "pie" and changes i "smile".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She chuckles to herself as she hears the sound of the bathroom DOOR OPENING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOTSTEPS walk on the tile floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM-- the first stall door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana flinches, hears: BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The footsteps move closer-- SLAM. The second stall door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the pumps, Aaron sees a handwritten sign that says, "Please pay inside".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the check-out and sees that the Mechanic has his jaw broken and his TEETH KNOCKED OUT. His uniform has been removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron cautiously steps into the garage. He looks past a t with the hood open and sees the LEGS of the ANOTHER MECHA protruding out of an office door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron grabs a crow bar off the workbench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana stares at a pair of DIRTY BOOTS outside her stall do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape, wearing a MECHANIC'S JUMPSUIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Someone's in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches as a hand REACHES OVER THE DOOR AND A DOZEN BLOODY, RIPPED OUT TEETH DROP AND SCATTER ONTO THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO HANDS grab the top of the stall door. The hands begin using force to PULL and PUSH the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can hear the metal distort under pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls her pants back on and slides to the ground, scrambles to crawl underneath into the succeeding stall..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana crawls on her stomach as the stall door is ripped op behind her. As she lies underneath she GETS PULLED BACKWA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles to hold onto the stall divider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicks as hard as she can. Her kick frees her. She quickly jumps up and shuts the stall door. LOCKS IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape BANGS on THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond The Shape's feet, DANA SEES THE BATHROOM DOOR SWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron's WHITE SNEAKERS STEP IN. One of the sneaker laces UNTIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh bollocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears a crowbar whack the Shape THREE SWIFT TIMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWN! DOWN! DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foot entangled, The Shape struggles with Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears Aaron being choked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowbar CLANGS on the tiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just within reach, she grabs the crowbar and pulls it bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over as Aaron is slammed into the stall door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees THE SHAPE'S FOOT and drives the crowbar into his boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron is yanked away. She sees Aaron's sneakers pull up o of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape drags Aaron. A loud crash and SHATTERED mirror rains on the tile floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a violent POUND POUND POUND on the stall door; it The Shape using Aaron's body as a battering ram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana screams-- BOOM-- the door flies opens, knocking the bar out of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape throws Aaron and we follow him as he lands in a corner by the trash can. His head hits hard on the tile floor. His open eyes face us. Aaron is bloody and twitchi in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape is in the stall with Dana. She is yanked up. We only see her head gripped by The Shape. Struggling as he chokes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron is useless on the ground. He's alive, his fingers reaching out as Dana goes lifeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cashier lays across the counter. On the transistor ra next to him we hear the local news do a spooky All Hallow Eve version of the weather report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking outside the shop window, we see The Shape digging deep down in the trunk of Aaron's car at the pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From INSIDE THE RENTAL CAR WE SEE the research binder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT UP TO SEE: The Shape as he picks up HIS MASK and put on. It's an eerie sight to behold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BREATHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Sartain lies in bed with his eyes closed, bandages ar his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Hawkins stands at his bedside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF BARKER (60's) enters with two coffees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still waiting to ID the patients we found to see who's who. Almost all accounted for. Found two of them trying to check their e-mail at the local library and three others holding hands and chasing butterflies by the flea market off 220. Any word from Rip van Winkle over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff sip his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. The nurses say he's been in and out. Lost a lot of blood. Somehow managed to fall on a bullet. I'm trying to get the story. Because here's my concern: Take a look at this list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins hands him the list. Sheriff scans it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the passengers were minor offenders. Mental patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on LIST. Sheriff's thumb glides over names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One stuck out. A-2201.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON LIST. Sheriff's thumb glides back up, land on "A 220. Myers, Michael"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Myers. The Babysitter Murders, 1978. It's forty years to the day. You think this is a coincidence or part of some greater plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff looks at Sartain laying there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Frank, I don't need to incite panic until we have all the facts. Myers loose with a bunch of nutbags in Haddonfield on Halloween night is a fucking joke if it's not legit. It sounds like a joke. It would ruin our department. And if it is legit. If Myers did escape, we're gonna have a serious circus on our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins looks at the Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what are we gonna do, cancel Halloween?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a reason we're supposed to be afraid of this night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins' radio squawks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch to 601. Dispatch to 601.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the school day. Various COSTUMED CHEERLEADERS driv by. They are piled in a convertible and honk the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky and Ally walk with Dave. Dave carries Vicky's back pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, bad news. I can't go to the dance tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a call to baby-sit. They                needed somebody at the last minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it. You didn't let up about me going and then you back out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good for you to go. You're going out with Cameron now. You'll hang with his friends. It's his scene. You can't just use homework as an excuse, can you? Can you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I like doing- I'm not being anti-social. I'm just... reserved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sheepish, only like in a               very fresh way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get to Vicky's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I wouldn't bail on you, but I need some cash, so I said I would. You'll have fun. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky's also gonna have some fun. She said if I behave, I can come over after the kid's nighty night and do cool stuff. Like clean dishes, mop up, keep her company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like my helpful pet. I appreciate you, Dave. If you help me mop and do dishes I'll take your virginity. Enough of this third base shit, right? We're adults.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her back pack from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally. Hey, wanna get matching tattoos so we can remember this day forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky laughs. Allyson turn and sees Oscar and Cameron wal across the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there's Cameron. I'm gonna catch up with him. You guys go on without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, if not you're pissed at me. Are you pissed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just thought... It'd be more fun if you'd hang with me. That's all. Cameron is sweet, but I'm still getting used to the idea... I don't know. And his friend...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar and Cameron walk across the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is, brother. What do you                      say? She's a knock out. I would definitely take her over me any day of the week. I'm not offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like her. I'm serious. And I don't want you to fuck this up by doing something stupid. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson walks up. Oscar sees the CHEERLEADERS drive by ag on the other side of the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Allyson. Guess what? Cameron                        likes you more than me, but I'm over it. I'll see you guys later. I'm gonna catch up with Bianca and                      see if any of those ladies need a handsome male escort to Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron and Allyson shrug and Oscar races off on a missio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a mess. (turns to Allyson) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I couldn't sleep. I was so embarrassed about last night. I'm sorry you had to see that. It's a weird time for me I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait till you meet my family. Your grandma has nothing on my Uncle James. Don't worry about that stuff, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I won't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH-- Hawkins stands in the door to the bathroom. The w covered in blood. He studies the crime scene with the cor as a PHOTOGRAPHER snaps pictures-- FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins observes the dead Cashier as a detective dusts fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars and ambulances are active at the crime scene. Lights flashing as OFFICERS try to piece it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the way, Laurie appears amongst the ONLOOKERS gath on the other side of the police tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins sees Laurie across the lot. He turns to a passing OFFICER RICHARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that who I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop sees Laurie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She calls the station at least twice a month. She's a paranoid pain in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Richards approaches Laurie, Hawkins joins the Sheriff. DETECTIVE in rubber gloves holds up the white hospital clothes found on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State issued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the phone to Smith's Grove and confirm the match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, we have to let people know, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until we have confirmation. I don't want the media foaming at the mouth and dragging the name of this town through the headlines again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I strongly disagree, sir. If this is who we think it is, we have one order of business. Hunt this man down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins looks to where Laurie was. She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before dark, a few KIDS are trick-or-treating in the stre as Shanah pulls up and stops in front of her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kid dressed in a costume slaps the hood of her car, startles her, and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah gets out of the car with a sack of groceries. We w her as she's greeted by a few costumed kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead quiet as Shanah opens her front door and enters home. She sees A LIGHT in the staircase on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves the door open behind her as she enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allyson? Anyone home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the food down on the kitchen counter and notices that all of her knives are spread out along the counter a on display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears something upstairs. A noise that could be the h settling or it could be something more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins walking toward the steps slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears footsteps above her. Someone's in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray appears abruptly in the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah turns and motions for him to be silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie appears at the top of the stairs holding a PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang. You're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared the shit out of me. What are you doing in my house?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Side window is unlocked. No security system. You have a dozen knives available for any psychotic to come in here and stab you with. Sometimes I can't tell the difference between ignorance and stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Jujitsu, Laurie. I can apply pressure points and choke holds to use the opponents force of attack against them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie walks down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael has escaped. I'd be a fool to think this is over. If he comes for my family, I'll be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Allyson? We have to get out of here. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, no one's coming after you and they're not coming after us. Get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shanah walks past her to hang up her jacket in the closet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should put down that gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie steps out onto the front porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Out of my way'. It's like I'm always in your way, aren't I, Shanah? You're always going somewhere and you're trying to leave me behind. Evil is real. You don't know what it's like to feel true terror. To live powerless. I don't ever want you to feel that way. I only want to train and protect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
